CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 6-2;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and resides in the village of GPE , GPE region , GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant worked as a director of a café in the town of LOC , GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant for plundering State property ( LAW ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with plundering ORG property in particularly large quantities ( LAW ) . The same day she was arrested .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released on bail subject to an undertaking not to abscond ( підписка про невиїзд ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal case was terminated for want of proof of a crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of Volodymyr - Volynskyy District quashed the decision of DATE and sent the case for further investigation .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , the criminal proceedings against the applicant were terminated partly for want of proof of a crime and partly on the ground that the further prosecution in her case was time - barred . The investigator did not find it proven that the applicant had been involved in plundering , but considered that her actions could be classified as negligence , which was an offence under LAW in the wording which was in force at the relevant time ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) . However , given that the statutory time - limit for prosecuting the applicant for negligence had passed , the criminal case in respect of that charge had to be discontinued as time - barred .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the Prosecutor of Volodymyr - Volynskyy District about the decision of CARDINAL DATE . This complaint was rejected . The applicant appealed to the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Volodymyr - Volynskyy District Court allowed the applicant ’s appeal and quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The court noted that a criminal case could be terminated on non - exonerative grounds , like a time - bar on further prosecution , only with the consent of the prosecuted person . As the applicant had never agreed to the termination of the case on this ground the investigation should be continued .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the investigator terminated the criminal proceedings against the applicant on the same grounds as previously .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the same court , upon the applicant ’s appeal , quashed this decision and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal case against the applicant was terminated for want of proof of a crime . At the same time , in his decree terminating the criminal proceedings against the applicant , the investigator mentioned that the courts had quashed the previous decisions on termination of the criminal case on non - exonerative grounds , because the applicant had not agreed . In the investigator ’s opinion the applicant ’s consent was not necessary , because even though her conduct could be qualified as a crime of negligence , no criminal proceedings could be instituted , as prosecution was time - barred and she could not be considered as an accused in this respect . The investigator , therefore , decided that :

“ In the actions of PERSON there are corpus delicti ( є склад злочину ) , provided for in LAW [ LAW GPE ] , that is negligence , of which she herself confessed to be guilty . Nevertheless , taking into account that from the moment when she had committed that crime ( час скоєння нею даного злочину ) the time - limits had expired ... the institution of a criminal case under LAW ORG should be rejected for being time - barred ... ”

CARDINAL . The applicant challenged the decision of DATE , requesting that her guilt be proved in judicial proceedings in accordance with LAW . She further submitted that closing the criminal case against her on non - exonerative grounds deprived her of a possibility to receive compensation for the unlawful actions taken against her .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Volodymyr - Volynskyy Local Court rejected the applicant ’s complaint about the decision of DATE . In its decision the court stated in particular :

“ As it appears from the materials of the criminal case against PERSON and the decision of the head of the investigating unit of ORG of DATE , the actions of PERSON disclose signs of the corpus delicti ( ознаки складу злочину ) provided for in LAW [ LAW GPE ] and she had acknowledged her guilt of having committed this offence .
According to LAW , in the wording of DATE , ... this crime was punishable by imprisonment for a period of DATE .

Under LAW I ( CARDINAL ) of the ORG , a person can not be charged with an offence if DATE have elapsed from the date when a criminal offence punishable under the law by imprisonment for a period of DATE was committed .
Under LAW § I ( CARDINAL ) [ of LAW ] no criminal proceedings could be initiated and any proceedings which had been started should be terminated as time - barred .
Therefore , in the above circumstances , no criminal case charging PERSON with an offence under LAW could be instituted because prosecution against her was time - barred . ”
This decision was not subject to appeal .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant lodged a claim with ORG , seeking compensation for damage caused by the allegedly unlawful criminal proceedings against her .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found in part for the applicant and awarded her UAH CARDINAL in compensation . The decision was not appealed against and became final .

CARDINAL . By letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of ORG , responsible for the enforcement of the decision , requested ORG to lodge a supervisory review appeal on the ground that ORG for DATE did not foresee expenditure of this kind . Following this request , the ORG sought supervisory review , arguing that the actions of the police were lawful and that the amount awarded to the applicant was too high , in particular given the difficult economic situation in the country .
CARDINAL . On DATE upon a supervisory review appeal of the prosecutor , the Presidium of the ORG quashed the decision of ORG of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Volodymyr - Volynskyy Local Court rejected the applicant ’s claim for compensation because the criminal proceedings against her had been terminated on a non - exonerative ground , namely that prosecution was time - barred . The court noted that it appeared from the decisions of CARDINAL DATE , DATE and DATE terminating the criminal case against the applicant , that her conduct disclosed signs of the corpus delicti provided for in LAW ( negligence ) , namely the inappropriate performance of professional duties by an official due to a negligent attitude , which had caused significant loss to the ORG ’s interests . The record of her interrogation of DATE showed that the applicant acknowledged her guilt of negligence . The court further stated that , given that the criminal case was terminated on a non - exonerative ground , the applicant lost the right to compensation under the PERSON “ on the procedure for compensation of damage caused to the citizen by the unlawful actions of bodies of inquiry , pre - trial investigation , prosecutors and courts ” .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal against that decision .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW reads as follows :

“ A person is presumed innocent of committing a crime and shall not be subjected to criminal punishment until his or her guilt is proved through legal procedure and established by a court verdict of guilty .
No one is obliged to prove his or her innocence of committing a crime .
An accusation shall not be based on illegally obtained evidence as well as on assumptions . All doubts in regard to the proof of guilt of a person are interpreted in his or her favour .
In the event that a court verdict is revoked as unjust , the ORG compensates the material and moral damages inflicted by the groundless conviction . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Code read as follows :
Article CARDINAL .
The statute of time - bar for instituting criminal proceedings
“ CARDINAL . A person can not be charged with an offence , if the following periods have elapsed from the date of the criminal offence :
... CARDINAL . DATE from the date of offence for committing a crime punishable under the law by imprisonment for the period of DATE ; ... ”
Article CARDINAL .
Plundering the ORG or collective property through misappropriation , embezzlement or malversation

“ CARDINAL . Misappropriation or embezzlement the ORG or collective property by a person to whom it was entrusted shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term of DATE , or a fine in the amount of CARDINAL non - taxable incomes , with or without deprivation of the right to occupy certain posts or to practice certain activities for the term of DATE ...

CARDINAL . Any such actions as provided for by paragraph CARDINAL or CARDINAL of this Article , if repeated or committed by a group of person upon their prior conspiracy shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term of DATE with or without a confiscation of property , with deprivation of the right to occupy certain posts or to practice certain activities for the term of DATE ... ”
Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL .
ORG or collective property in particular large quantities

“ ORG or collective property , performed in particularly large quantities , regardless of the manner of plundering ( ORG DATE , and CARDINAL ) shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term of DATE with the forfeiture of property . ”

LAW prior to DATE provided for a sanction of imprisonment of DATE for negligence , that was “ the failure to perform or improper performance , by an official , of his or her official duties due to careless or inaccurate attitude , which caused significant damage to the state or public interests or to the legally protected rights and interests of individual physical or legal persons ” .

CARDINAL . At the material time paragraph CARDINAL of part I of LAW provided that criminal proceedings could not be initiated and started proceedings should be terminated if further prosecution was time - barred . This provision was repealed on DATE . At the same time the right to close the case as time - barred was given to the courts .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code laid down the conditions for refusing to institute criminal proceedings against a person and Article CARDINAL the conditions for terminating the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . The termination of criminal proceedings on the ground of paragraph CARDINAL of part I of LAW required the applicant ’s consent .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the PERSON read as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ The right to compensation for damages in the amount and in accordance with the procedure established by this PERSON shall arise in the cases of :
acquittal by a court ;

termination of a criminal case on grounds of absence of proof of commission of a crime , absence of corpus delicti , or lack of evidence of the accused ’s participation in the commission of the crime ;
refusal to initiate criminal proceedings or termination of criminal proceedings on the grounds stipulated in sub - paragraph CARDINAL of paragraph CARDINAL of this Article ;
termination of proceedings for an administrative offence . ”
